title: What Nubrac did IS against the rules
body:
I just want to clarify this for everyone, so that no one who's uninformed gets lead astray by the people who don't know the rules and who are trying to say his punishment was false:

Summoner's Code rule number 1 is Support Your Team. In paragraph 2, it states: 

* Being a good team player begins at champion select. Be open minded when considering the needs of your team. If you're the last one to pick, try to fill a niche in your team that hasn't already been filled. If everyone's picked and something stands out as a deficiency in your team composition, try asking for another player to fill the gap, or change roles to embrace that responsibility yourself.

Whether or not you _like_ that this is a rule is a different matter. But as it currently stands, selfishly troll picking a "strategy" that requires your entire team pick and play around your poor choice, and/or refusing to play your assigned role in any Draft mode just because you don't feel like it, _is against the rules._ Now, it will take multiple games of this to actually see punishment so if you wanna skirt the line every now and then, they won't catch you. But do it consistently like Nubrac did, and you will receive punishment. 

This is not my _opinion_ on the matter. This is and has always been Riot's interpretation of their stated rules. Stay safe, and be a team player.
****

It's exactly like following the chat rules. Whether or not you agree that calling people trash every game should warrant a punishment, it will.
****

Edit: I'd like to mention, if you want to do such a thing in Blind pick, where roles are not assigned, you could make a much stronger case for not following roles. But if you want to play either Draft mode, Normal or Ranked, then your duty to support your team begins by following your assigned role. Or at least asking if anyone will trade you and accepting their decision. 

If you don't want your role assigned, then you're free to not play the Draft mode. As it goes, whether you decide to only play normal blind or decide you're fine getting punished for it, you'll miss out on the Victorious skin either way. The punishment you receive is the consequence you get for deciding not to be a team player. If it's worth more to you to get to be selfish, then by all means embrace the punishment you asked for.

Thank you, _finally_ someone gets it.

 Look, Teemo support or roaming Teemo support is not punishable on it's own, it is and should be punishable when you aren't cooperating with your teammates. Plenty of high ELO players (namely Doublelift and Jensen although a few others have come forward like Hashinshin, Yassuo, and IreliaCarriesU.) have come out and openly said that Nubrac doesn't communicate and is often more of a detriment than a benefit. 

  Nightblue should be held accountable for what he said, Nubrac should be held accountable for what he did. There are no sides to pick here.

But that's kind of where the problem lies. One toxic person is using his Riot connections to get someone banned. Wouldn't it make sense for them to investigate that whole game fully then and also see NB3's toxic attitude there? Only Nubrac got punished for that game yakno.

> But that's kind of where the problem lies. One toxic person is using his Riot connections to get someone banned. Wouldn't it make sense for them to investigate that whole game fully then and also see NB3's toxic attitude there? 

## [Riot has already stated that multiple people have reported Nubrac for his actions.](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/c0m449/nightblue3_gets_his_teammate_banned_for_playing/er61hxj/?context=3)

>Only Nubrac got punished for that game yakno.

 Riot hasn't made a decision on the situation as a whole IIRC. If Nightblue doesn't get punished, yeah, that's very hypocritical and I don't agree with that at all.

I mean to be fair, most of those that play league probably do not want to be involved in the chat functions full stop. A lot of the time, it is nothing but childish, petty toxicity. 

That is part of the prominent culture of the game which has developed, so can you really blame people for simply deciding not to make use of it at all? 

The entire thing is a double-edged sword though. Nonetheless, I'd still prefer having someone in my team that is actually contributing to the game - even if it is their own strategy - as opposed to those who will sit and AFK in the base.

All you are required to do is make a good faith effort to win the game. If that means supporting irelia, then irelia is getting supported.

> There are sides to pick here. You DO NOT, and i repeat, DO NOT, need to ask your god damn teams permission how to play the game. If you want to support mid, congratulations, mid now has a support. 

 Do you know what's most critical to success at high level play? 

 _Communication._

 You can solo-carry a game at Silver IV because people aren't coordinated at that level of play, you can't win a game at the highest level of play unless everyone is on the same page which _isn't going to happen if you stay dead silent throughout the match while going roaming Teemo support._

 If you think differently, that's totally fine and you're entitled to that opinion but the overwhelming majority of the community abides by a meta for a reason and if they choose to deviate from it you'd better have the skills to back it up or your team had better be prepared for that.

 (Friendly reminder: Nubrac had a higher winrate with both Amumu and Leona, his Teemo is currently sitting at a 48% WR across 400 games. His teammates didn't want him to play it, he's not performing well with it, and that statistic is _probably_ misleading because it's counting all games of Teemo, not just support. Basically, his winrate is most likely lower than 48%.) 

> All you are required to do is make a good faith effort to win the game. If that means supporting irelia, then irelia is getting supported.

 So, knowing full well that your teammate doesn't agree with that playstyle and doesn't want you to do it, you go to support Irelia.

 Great! She's up 2 kills and 20 CS, but because you've been leeching off her XP she falls behind and might not be as relevant in teamfights. In addition to that, your ADC is 0/4 with 35 CS by 14 minutes. He's tilted, doesn't want to play the game anymore, and is so far behind that it would take a miracle for him to come back to relevancy. 

 "Good faith" is not all that's required to win a game. League is a _team_ game for a reason, you have allies. Cooperate with them, discuss your plan, _tell_ them what you're going to be doing instead of leaving them in the dark like Nubrac.

That is easily the worst way to portray that game possible. First, lets start with the obvious nonsense. "Irelia DOES NOT NEED LEVELS nearly as much as mages. She gains no major powerspike at 6 compared to mages.". Have you ever *played* Irelia? She gets a gigantic powerspike at level 6. You know that little cage of her? The one that gives her an instant mark for a Q reset, does a decent amount of initial damage, and also cuts off the primary escape route with further damage and a 90% slow? The one that you use in pretty much all burst combos because its better and more reliable than just her E? Yeah, turns out that thing is a serious powerboost. 

Second, yes, TF cant use his usual level 6 teleport ganks in that scenario. But not for that reason, but for the simple reason that his bot is winning by default anyway. The situation is so lopsided that he has to do nothing to win. Thats quite huge for his team. 

"Sivir CAN EASILY hold bot solo", well, lets add Sivir to the pile of champs you talk about while having clearly no experience with them. No, of course Sivir cannot hold bot solo until she gets items. Her W does pathetic damage at level 1, and even her Qs waveclear is mediocre before she gets at least a BF sword. Instead what happens is *exactly* what we saw happen in the game. They get pushed in hard, lose a ton of CS and a lot of turret platings. The lane is lost by default.

Now, if maybe mid got an actual advantage, that couldve maybe worked (though his refusal to communicate still makes it banworthy). Except mid didnt. He fell behind severely in xp and was just not a major factor anymore. Ontop of all of that, Teemo himself was useless, so it was a 4v5 with everyone far behind.

His team played the game. They lost hard and only went afk when the game was clearly over. And no, Teemo was easily griefing his team. He screwed over botlane, making Sivir, a scaling ADC, fall behind hard in CS and Platings, losing a lot of gold and basically making that lane lost. He screwed over midlane, making Irelia, a champ that *needs* levels be unable to get those levels. And he even screwed up his jungler by forcing him to play around botside meaning that toplane was easy pickings.

And yet, the majority of players playing on the level where they would encounter this guy have come out clearly stating that yes, he *is* trolling and that they absolutely support the ban. Oh and worse yet? Turns out Riot investigated and found out, he only does this "strat" when playing with streamers, and when he plays this strat, his win rate is 38%. Its intentional griefing to promote his stream. Thats why he was banned. Good riddance.

Well...what you call basic game knowledge, and what's actually basic game knowledge, aren't exactly aligned as properly as you're implying.

At one point, there wasn't an assigned laning system. Those times have changed. And though I will forever be the type of person to challenge the meta and the concept that the lanes need to be assigned in a certain way to begin with, Riot has indeed decided to limit the playstyle of a typical game by assigning a 1/1/1/2 layout. I wouldn't call that a meta anymore, I'd call it a template. It's part of the reason this game's become a meme.

That being said, the meta shifted to this template as early as season 2, and really hadn't changed all that much since. Riot attempted to force that change once by essentially trying to make bruiser/support or double bruiser bot a thing, which would've definitely changed the meta in the long run, but they determined after completely screwing adcs and making all games take 40 years (read, "fuck the tank meta") to instead  more or less lock in the current model.

Imo, that locking of a template is hurting their design space almost as much as the new runes setup and their items.
Think about it that way, and you know why I personally don't like it. You see a new strategy like the "support mid, funnel the jungle" strat, and everyone now *loses their collective shit* about it until it's nerfed. You see Jungle Karthus making a comeback - nerfstick that, Karthus is a mid laner! Don't EVEN get me started on top - nobody, even riot, knows that the hell's going on up there. It's like the "misc" drawer for LoL at this point, and though people like me have the most fun with that sort of aspect of randomness, I understand the rage of top laners currently. In a game where every other lane only needs to know how to play 2-3 champs, and know how to play them *against* a few FotW champs that are more or less pick/ban for their lane, it's definitely not as fun being the guy who needs to know how to play about 5-7 champs against damn near 2/3 of the game that may potentially show up there.

While I agree with the *concept* of abolishing this template and making the game feel more open again, I still do not agree with the means that were used in this one. There's a clear difference between fighting the meta, and just non-chalantly doing what you want without any regard for win/loss. Supporting mid in my book is not a troll tactic - that's fighting the meta. Supporting mid without telling anyone you're supporting mid, and not communicating a damn thing while everyone on your team is unable to comprehend what the hell it is you're working towards, is trolling.

Even when I do insanely off-meta things like Hail of Blades mid Nami, I tell people straight up before locking it "I plan to play pretty aggressive with my E in lane and just dominate early. I'll be building more for damage than for support, but I'll pretty much be a support by late game, so jng should pick for heavy dps. I'll try and roam a lot once I hit 6. If it seems like I'm failing, just gank mid a lot and take the farm, we'll play this as a boosting strat." A bunch of steps to say "I know what I'm doing, and if it turns out I'm bad, here's what to do to cover for my dumb ass."

It's not "permission." It's communication. There's a huge difference between the two. I agree with PF - you don't need your team's *permission* to play something. But if you're not going to take the time to explain what you're doing so people know how to work with or around it, then you're trolling them. And in a case like Nub vs NB3 here, if your off-meta tactic is going to affect multiple other people's usual sense of how to play, they definitely get a say in whether they feel comfortable trying it or not. I've had plenty of games where I've won by just being open about doing something wacky and my team doing really well with joining me. I've had just as many completely ruined by someone just locking something super off-meta and gallivanting around the game doing something only they understand. To anyone who doesn't get it, it looks like trolling.

NB3 didn't get it - Nub looked like he was trolling. And he very well may have been. It's not exactly easy to say it was his intention to sabotage his team, but he did. And without communicating anything, it does surely look like he never planned to work with them from the start, which doesn't help his case.
